head.title: Mob Case Defendant Is Shot in Brooklyn

hedline.hl1: Mob Case Defendant Is Shot in Brooklyn
hedline.hl2: Mob Case Defendant Is Shot in Brooklyn

block.p: A reputed mobster associated with the Gambino crime family was shot at least three times while sitting in his car on a Brooklyn street yesterday morning, the police said.

The man, Robert DeCicco, 56, was hit in the arm and leg and grazed in the head while parked in front of 1678 Bath Avenue in Bath Beach about 10:30 a.m., the police said. He was treated at Lutheran Medical Center and released.

A reputed mobster associated with the Gambino crime family was shot at least three times while sitting in his car on a Brooklyn street yesterday morning, the police said.

The man, Robert DeCicco, 56, was hit in the arm and leg and grazed in the head while parked in front of 1678 Bath Avenue in Bath Beach about 10:30 a.m., the police said. He was treated at Lutheran Medical Center and released.

In January, Mr. DeCicco, who lives on Staten Island, was indicted on federal racketeering charges in Brooklyn along with his father, George DeCicco, and 11 others as part of an 11-month investigation of the Gambino and Luchese families and the Sicilian Mafia.

George DeCicco is a high-ranking Gambino captain, federal authorities said. The charges against the group included racketeering, loan-sharking, extortion, bribery of a federal official, money laundering, attempted bank fraud and check forgery.

Witnesses said that before the shooting yesterday, Mr. DeCicco went to get a prescription filled at Dolinsky Pharmacy and then went to the nearby Nick's Discount Store. He was shot after getting back into his car, according to the police. A light-colored Lincoln sped away immediately after the shooting, investigators said. No one had been arrested last night.

This is not the first time a member of the DeCicco family has been the victim of violence. Robert DeCicco's cousin, Frank DeCicco, was killed in a car explosion outside a Bensonhurst social club on April 13, 1986.
